description:
The 1900 edition of the "Santa Biblia Antigua Versi칩n" is a continuation of the enduring legacy of the Reina-Valera translation, a cornerstone of the Spanish biblical literature. This edition is particularly significant as it represents the culmination of the dedicated efforts of two eminent scholars, Casiodoro de Reina and Cipriano de Valera.

Casiodoro de Reina first translated and published this version of the Bible in 1569, a process that demanded twelve years of intensive work. His commitment to accurately translating the scriptures was driven by a desire to make the Bible accessible to the Spanish-speaking public. The initial publication, which included the complete Bible, was a significant achievement in the field of biblical translations.

The work was later revised and enhanced by Cipriano de Valera, who dedicated over twenty years to its revision and improvement, resulting in the 1602 version. This revised edition focused on refining the accuracy and clarity of the translation.

It not only reflects the scholarly rigour of its translators but also continues to serve as an important religious text for Spanish-speaking Christian communities worldwide.
